             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3 id="ae70" class="graf graf--h3 graf-after--p">Machine Learning Tools</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="https://google.ai/tools/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Google.ai</strong></a> – AI tools from Google 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://google.ai/tools/tensorflow/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>TensorFlow</strong></a> – Google library for the optimization of machine learning algorithms, similar to Theano 
               <ul> 
                <li><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Tensorflow Tutorials</a> (tensorflow.org)</li> 
                <li><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://medium.com/@erikhallstrm/hello-world-tensorflow-649b15aed18c" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Introduction to TensorFlow?—?CPU vs GPU</a> (medium.com/@erikhallstrm)</li> 
                <li><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://blog.metaflow.fr/tensorflow-a-primer-4b3fa0978be3" target="_blank" rel="noopener">TensorFlow: A primer</a> (metaflow.fr)</li> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/fold/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TensorFlow Fold</a> – &nbsp;dynamic computation graps</li> 
                <li><a href="https://research.googleblog.com/2017/05/introducing-tensorflow-research-cloud.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TensorFlow Research Cloud</a> –&nbsp;Access to Google’s&nbsp;<a href="https://cloud.google.com/tpu/">Cloud TPUs</a></li> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/syntaxnet" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SyntaxNet</a> – most accurate Natural Language parser</li> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TF Learn</a> (aka Scikit Flow) –&nbsp;simplified interface for TensorFlow</li> 
               </ul> </li> 
              <li><strong><a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/machine-learning/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Machine Learning Services</a></strong> –&nbsp;neural net-based ML service 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/ml-engine/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Machine Learning Engine</a> –&nbsp;managed service to build machine learning models</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/jobs-api/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Jobs</a> – job search and discovery for the talent industry</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/video-intelligence/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Video Intelligence</a> –&nbsp;videos searchable/discoverable, by extracting metadata with a&nbsp;REST API</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/vision/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Vision API</a> – Image classifier&nbsp;in an REST API</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/speech/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Speech API</a> – Speech recognizer, convert audio to text</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/natural-language/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Natural Language</a> API –&nbsp;extract information, understand sentiment in text documents, news blogs</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/translate/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Cloud Translation API</a> –&nbsp;translate an arbitrary string into any supported language</li> 
                <li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/prediction/docs" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Google Prediction API</a> –&nbsp;provides pattern-matching and machine learning capabilities&nbsp;<em>deprecated and will be shut down on April 30, 2018</em></li> 
               </ul> </li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li id="03ef" class="graf graf--h4 graf-after--p"><strong>PyTorch –&nbsp;</strong>deep-learning framework from Facebook 
             <ul> 
              <li id="76c7" class="graf graf--p graf-after--h4"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="http://pytorch.org/tutorials/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">PyTorch Tutorials</a>&nbsp;– pytorch.org</li> 
              <li id="b62c" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="http://blog.gaurav.im/2017/04/24/a-gentle-intro-to-pytorch/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">A Gentle Intro to PyTorch</a> – gaurav.im</li> 
              <li id="9db7" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://iamtrask.github.io/2017/01/15/pytorch-tutorial/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Tutorial: Deep Learning in PyTorch</a> – iamtrask.github.io</li> 
              <li id="9f68" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://github.com/jcjohnson/pytorch-examples" target="_blank" rel="noopener">PyTorch Examples</a> – github.com/jcjohnson</li> 
              <li id="c997" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://github.com/MorvanZhou/PyTorch-Tutorial" target="_blank" rel="noopener">PyTorch Tutorial</a> – github.com/MorvanZhou</li> 
              <li id="c168" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial" target="_blank" rel="noopener">PyTorch Tutorial for Deep Learning Researchers</a>&nbsp;– github.com/yunjey</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/cognitive-toolkit/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit</strong></a> – open&nbsp;source deep-learning toolkit 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://www.microsoft.com/cognitive-services/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Microsoft Cognitive Services</a> – machine learning with REST APIs</li> 
              <li><a href="http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/machine-learning/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Azure Machine Learning</a> – cloud-based predictive analytics 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Azure Machine Learning Tutorial</a> – microsoft 
                 <ul> 
                  <li><a href="http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/machine-learning-r-quickstart/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">start guide to R for Azure Machine Learning</a> – microsoft</li> 
                 </ul> </li> 
               </ul> </li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/Theano/Theano" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Theano</strong></a> –&nbsp;&nbsp;Python numerical computation library to&nbsp;evaluate math expressions involving multi-dimensional arrays 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/lisa-lab/pylearn2" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Pylearn2</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;machine learning&nbsp;library built on Theano</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/fchollet/keras" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Keras</a> –&nbsp;machine learning&nbsp;library built on Theano</li> 
              <li><a href="http://deeplearning.net/tutorial/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Theano Deep Learning Tutorial</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://developer.salesforce.com/blogs/developer-relations/2017/05/using-einstein-vision-within-golang.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>Salesforce Einstein Vision</strong></a> –&nbsp;deep learning to automatically recognize images w/API to build AI-enabled apps.</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/apache/incubator-systemml" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>IBM / Apache SystemML</strong></a> –&nbsp;machine learning language written in Java;algorithm customizability, execution modes in, Standalone, Hadoop Batch, and Spark Batch, automatic optimization</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/baidu/paddle" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Baidu/Paddle</a> –&nbsp;</strong>Parallel&nbsp;Distributed Deep Learning toolkit</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/baidu-research/DeepBench" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DeepBench</strong></a> –&nbsp;deep learning benchmark from&nbsp;Baidu</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://gym.openai.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OpenAI Gym</a></strong> – toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement learning algorithms</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>XGboost</strong></a> – scalable and portable gradient boosting</li> 
           </ul> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://torch.ch" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Torch</strong></a> –&nbsp;scientific computing framework with wide support for machine learning algorithms – from Facebook 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/facebook/fbcunn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Cunn</strong></a> –&nbsp;examples to train classifiers over&nbsp;<a href="http://www.image-net.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">ImageNet</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://caffe.berkeleyvision.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Caffe</a></strong>: deep learning framework&nbsp;for convolutional neural network algorithms from UC Berkeley 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1UeKXVgRvvxg9OUdh_UiC5G71UMscNPlvArsWER41PsU/edit#slide=id.p">DIY Deep Learning for Vision with Caffe</a>&nbsp;– presentation</li> 
              <li><a href="http://caffe.berkeleyvision.org/tutorial/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Caffe documentation</a>&nbsp;– tutorial</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://caffe2.ai" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Caffe2</strong></a> –&nbsp;framework for machine learning products</li> 
            <li><a href="http://webscope.sandbox.yahoo.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Yahoo Webscope</strong></a> – machine learning datasets 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://webscope.sandbox.yahoo.com/catalog.php?datatype=r&amp;did=75" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Yahoo newsfeed dataset</a>&nbsp;– 1.5TBytes</li> 
              <li><a href="http://webscope.sandbox.yahoo.com/catalog.php?datatype=i" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Yahoo image datasets</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://mahout.apache.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Apache Mahout</strong></a> –&nbsp;Random Decision Forest classifier</li> 
            <li><a href="http://bid2.berkeley.edu/bid-data-project/download/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>BidData Suite</strong></a> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://eecs.berkeley.edu/~hzhao/papers/BD.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Overview</a> –&nbsp;John Canny, Huasha Zhao</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/BIDData/BIDMach" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BIDMach</a> –&nbsp;CPU and GPU-accelerated Machine Learning Library to build and use machine learning models 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/BIDData/BIDMach/wiki" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BidMach Wiki</a></li> 
               </ul> </li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/BIDData/BIDMat" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BIDMat</a> –&nbsp;CPU / GPU-accelerated matrix library for data mining 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/BIDData/BIDMat/wiki" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BidMat Wiki</a></li> 
               </ul> </li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong>Java Libraries</strong> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://deeplearning4j.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Deeplearning4j</a> –&nbsp;library written in&nbsp;Java</li> 
              <li><a href="http://nd4j.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ND4J</a> -scientific computing library in Java</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong>NVIDIA CUDA</strong> –&nbsp;parallel computing platform and programming model 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CUDA toolkit</a> – NVIDIA</li> 
              <li><a href="http://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/developertrainingmaterials/presentations/general/Introduction_to_CUDA_Platform.pptx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">intro to CUDA programming</a>&nbsp;– NVIDIA</li> 
              <li><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/cuDNN" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">cuDNN</a> –&nbsp;GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural networks</li> 
              <li><a href="https://code.google.com/p/cuda-convnet2/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">cuda-convnet</a>2: High performance C++/CUDA implementation of convolutional neural networks</li> 
              <li><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/gpu-accelerated-libraries" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">GPU accelerated libraries</a>&nbsp;– NVIDIA</li> 
              <li><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/digits" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Digits</a> – deep learning GPU Training System 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Digits on github</a></li> 
                <li><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/devbox" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DigitsDevBox</a> – GPU development hardware</li> 
               </ul> </li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://developer.nvidia.com/cuBLAS" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">cuBLAS</a></strong>: GPU-accelerated version of the complete standard BLAS library</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.mathworks.com/gpu" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">MATLAB</a></strong>: Easy-to-use HPC language integrating computation, visualization, and programming 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/kyunghyuncho/deepmat" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Deepmat</a> –&nbsp;Matlab Code for Restricted/Deep Boltzmann Machines and Autoencoders</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/rasmusbergpalm/DeepLearnToolbox" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DeepLearningToolbox</a> –&nbsp;Deep Belief Nets, Stacked Autoencoders, Convolutional Neural Nets, Convolutional Autoencoders and vanilla Neural Nets</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/sdemyanov/ConvNet" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ConvNet</a> –&nbsp;Convolutional Neural Networks for Matlab</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/antinucleon/cxxnet" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">cxxnet</a></strong>:&nbsp;Neural network toolkit</li> 
            <li><a href="http://cs.stanford.edu/people/karpathy/convnetjs/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ConvNetjs</strong></a> –&nbsp;Javascript library for training Deep Learning models (mainly Neural Networks)&nbsp;in your browser</li> 
            <li><a href="https://sigopt.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SigOpt</strong></a> – tunes machine learning algorithms with&nbsp;Bayesian optimization</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.darpa.mil/Our_Work/I2O/Programs/Probabilistic_Programming_for_Advanced_Machine_Learning_(PPAML).aspx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Probabilistic Programming for Advancing Machine Learning (PPAML)</a></strong> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://gamalon.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gamalon</a> –&nbsp;Probabilistic Programming&nbsp;at scale</li> 
              <li><a href="http://mc-stan.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Stan</a> –&nbsp;probabilistic programming language</li> 
              <li><a href="https://pymc-devs.github.io/pymc3/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PyMC3</a> –&nbsp;python module for Bayesian statistical modeling and model fitting</li> 
              <li><a href="http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/cambridge/projects/infernet/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Infer.NET</a> – Microsoft&nbsp;framework for running Bayesian inference in graphical models</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/AnalogDevicesLyricLabs/dimple/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Dimple</a> –&nbsp;Java and Matlab libraries for probabilistic inference</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/AnalogDevicesLyricLabs/chimple/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chimple</a> –&nbsp;Probabilistic Programming Java API</li> 
              <li><a href="http://web.stanford.edu/~ngoodman/papers/POPL2013-abstract.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Principles and Practice of Probabilistic Programming</a> – Noah Goodman</li> 
              <li><a href="http://dippl.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Design and Implementation of Probabilistic Programming Languages</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Noah D. Goodman and Andreas Stuhlmüller</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://eferm.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/05/cheat3.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Algorithms for supervised and unsupervised learning</strong></a> –</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/YouTube+Multiview+Video+Games+Dataset" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">UCI Machine Learning Repository</a></strong>&nbsp;– 120k instances, each described by 13 feature types, with class information, useful for exploring multiview topics (cotraining, ensembles, clustering,..)</li> 
            <li><a href="https://snap.stanford.edu/data/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Stanford large network dataset collection</strong></a> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://www.cise.ufl.edu/research/sparse/matrices/SNAP/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Visualizations of SNAP networks</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.sparkbeyond.com/#head" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SparkBeyond</strong></a> – predictive analytics</li> 
            <li><a href="http://revolutionanalytics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Revolution R</strong></a> – statistic programming language</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.kaggle.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Kaggle</strong></a> – competitions, predictive analysis, tutorials</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.crowdanalytix.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CrowdAnalytix</strong></a> – Crowdsourced analytics</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.drivendata.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DrivenData</strong></a> – crowdsourced&nbsp;statistical model for difficult predictive <em>social&nbsp;</em>problems</li> 
            <li><a href="http://mlcomp.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>MLcomp</strong></a> –&nbsp;compare&nbsp;machine learning programs across various datasets for multiple problem&nbsp;domains</li> 
            <li><a href="https://dato.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Dato</strong></a> –&nbsp;build intelligent apps fast with the power of Dato’s machine learning platform</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/Z3Prover/z3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Z3 Theorem Prover</strong></a> – open source</li> 
            <li><a href="http://sirius.clarity-lab.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Sirius</strong></a> – open source intelligent personal assistant, image/speech</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.pachyderm.io" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Pachyderm</strong></a> – containerized data analytics</li> 
            <li><a href="https://prediction.io" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>PredictionIO</strong></a> – an open-source machine learning server –&nbsp;create predictive engines for production environments (Spark, HBase, and Spray)</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.datameer.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Datameer</strong></a> – end-to-end big data analytics application purpose-built for HadoopInSpread – sophisticated analysis even if you’re not a data scientist</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.yhathq.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Yhathq</strong></a> – predictive models and data-science in a box</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://www.palantir.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Palantir</a></strong> – large scale data fusion analytics and visualization</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.datarobot.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Data Robot</strong></a> – nontraditional consulting firm that gets clients up and running quickly and makes them self-sufficient with predictive modeling platform (R, Python, Hadoop, Spark)</li> 
            <li><a href="http://popily.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Popily</strong></a> – go from spreadsheets to discoveries while you grab a cup of coffee</li> 
            <li><strong>Deep Learning/Machine Learning/Data Science Blogs</strong> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://tm.durusau.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Another word for it</a>&nbsp;– Patrick Durusau</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <p><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="17925" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/machine-intelligence/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg" data-orig-size="1600,1200" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="machine intelligence" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=468&amp;h=351" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-17925" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=468&amp;h=351" alt="machine intelligence" width="468" height="351" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=468&amp;h=351 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=936&amp;h=702 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=150&amp;h=113 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=300&amp;h=225 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-intelligence.jpg?w=768&amp;h=576 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <p>&nbsp;</p> 
           <p><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png"><img data-attachment-id="18141" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/machine-learning-skills/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png" data-orig-size="1445,1080" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="machine learning skills" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=468&amp;h=350" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-18141" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=468&amp;h=350" alt="machine learning skills" width="468" height="350" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=468&amp;h=350 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=936&amp;h=700 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=150&amp;h=112 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=300&amp;h=224 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/machine-learning-skills.png?w=768&amp;h=574 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <h3>Big Data Analytics / Log Management</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><span style="color:#0000ee;"><b><u>Splunk</u></b></span>&nbsp;– log mgmt searching, monitoring, and analyzing&nbsp;machine-generated&nbsp;big data</li> 
            <li><strong><span class="qlink_container"><a href="https://www.sumologic.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Sumo Logic</a></span></strong><span class="qlink_container">&nbsp;–&nbsp;log&nbsp;analytics platform</span></li> 
            <li><strong><span class="qlink_container"><span style="color:#0000ee;"><u><a href="https://www.loggly.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Loggly</a></u></span>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</span></strong><span class="qlink_container">mine log data in real time</span></li> 
            <li><span style="color:#0000ee;"><b><u>ElasticLogstash</u></b></span>&nbsp;– open-source log management</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://rapidminer.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">RapidMiner</a></strong> – analytics platform, data mining, machine learning</li> 
            <li><a href="http://datarpm.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DataRPM</strong></a> – machine analytics for big data</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.metamind.io" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Metamind</strong></a> – deep learning for the enterprise</li> 
            <li><a href="http://wandora.org/www/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Wandora</strong></a> –&nbsp;knowledge management application 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XAAqd__nTHM" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Great wandora tutorial</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Computer Vision/Image Recognition/Facial recognition/biometrics</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.pointclouds.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PCL</a></strong> – Point Cloud&nbsp;open source&nbsp;2D/3D image and point cloud processing&nbsp;Library</li> 
            <li><b><a href="http://opencv.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OpenCV</a> –&nbsp;</b>open source computer vision<b>&nbsp;</b>library</li> 
            <li><a href="http://simplecv.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SimpleVC</strong></a> – open source computer vision Python library</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://developer.qualcomm.com/software/fastcv-sdk" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FastCV</a> –</strong> Qualcomm computer vision library for ARM</li> 
            <li><a href="http://scikit-image.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Scikit</strong></a> – open source image processing in Python</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/JalaliLabUCLA/Image-feature-detection-using-Phase-Stretch-Transform" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PhaseStretchTransform</a>&nbsp;</strong> – Jalali Labs at UCLA</li> 
            <li><a href="http://image-net.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ImageNet</strong></a> –&nbsp;easily accessible image database&nbsp;for researchers organized according to the WordNet hierarchy 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://www.image-net.org/challenges/LSVRC/2014/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Contest</a>–&nbsp;largest academic challenge in computer vision</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <ul> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://github.com/openimages/dataset" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OpenImages</a></strong> – Google 9million image dataset annotated URL’s&nbsp;over 6000 categories</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.vision.caltech.edu/Image_Datasets/Caltech101/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Caletch 101</a></strong> –&nbsp;Pictures of objects belonging to 101 categories. About 40 to 800 images per category</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://static.googleusercontent.com/media/research.google.com/en/us/pubs/archive/40814.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Great paper</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong>Fast, Accurate Detection of 100,000 Object Classes on a Single Machine</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.clarifai.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Clarifai</a></strong> -Machine Intelligence API for mobile devices</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/torch/cunn" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Torch/fbcunn</strong></a> –&nbsp;examples to train classifiers over&nbsp;<a href="http://www.image-net.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">ImageNet</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://cmucam.org/projects/cmucam5" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Pixy</strong></a> – Open source vision system, connects to Arduino</li> 
            <li><a href="http://camfindapp.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Camfind</strong></a> – Image Recognition API</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/jhauswald/sirius" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Sirius</strong></a> – open source&nbsp;Speech and Vision Based Intelligent Personal Assistant</li> 
            <li><a href="http://vision.ai" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>vision.ai</strong></a> – real-time vision servers and clusters 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://docs.vision.ai/#about-vmx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">VMX</a> –&nbsp;real-time object detection and recognition system</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.kitware.com/solutions/computervision/computervision.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Kitware</strong></a> –&nbsp;open source image and video retrieval platforms 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://www.kwiver.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">KWIVER</a> – support for Kitware –</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.motiondsp.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>MotionDSP</strong></a> – GPU, realtime video enhancement and forensics</li> 
            <li><strong>Blogs</strong> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://quantombone.blogspot.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Tombone’s Computer Vision Blog</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Tomasz Malisiewicz</li> 
              <li><a href="http://image-sensors-world.blogspot.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Image Sensors World</a> – great blog on image sensor industry</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://moodstocks.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Moodstocks</strong></a> – image search against a database of references you supply; mobile app developer platform</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.blinkfire.com/landing" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Blinkfire</strong></a> – uses computer vision to measure media value and impact for sports teams</li> 
            <li><a href="http://slyce.it" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Slyce.it</strong></a> – visual search, image and retail item identification for retailers and brands</li> 
            <li><a href="http://imagevision.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ImageVision</strong></a> – big data for images and videos</li> 
            <li><a href="https://visenze.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ViSenze</strong></a>&nbsp;– visual search technology</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.openalpr.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>OpenALPR</strong></a> – open automatic license plate reader software 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/openalpr/openalpr" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OpenALPR Github</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <h4>Facial Recognition / Biometrics</h4> 
           <ul> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://biolab.csr.unibo.it/fvcongoing/UI/Form/Home.aspx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FVC-ongoing</a></strong> –&nbsp;automated evaluation system developed to evaluate biometric algorithms</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.nist.gov/itl/iad/ig/colorferet.cfm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>FERET</strong></a> –&nbsp;large database of facial images</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.scface.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SCface</strong></a> – Surveillance Cameras Face Database 
             <ul> 
              <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://atvs.ii.uam.es/scfacedb_landmarks.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SCfaceDB Landmarks</a>– facial recognition landmarks</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.flintbox.com/public/project/4742/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CMU Multi-pie</strong></a> – Face database</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://arxiv.org/abs/1503.03832" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Facenet</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong>A Unified Embedding for Face Recognition and Clustering</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://vision.ucsd.edu/~iskwak/ExtYaleDatabase/ExtYaleB.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Yale Face database B</a>&nbsp;</strong>–&nbsp;16128 images of 28 human subjects under 9 poses and 64 illumination conditions</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.openu.ac.il/home/hassner/Adience/data.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Adience</a></strong>–&nbsp;&nbsp;26,580 images, 2,284 individuals, classified for 8 age groups, gender and</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://vintage.winklerbros.net/facescrub.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FaceScrub</a></strong> – A Dataset With Over 100,000 Face Images of 530 People</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.openu.ac.il/home/hassner/projects/frontalize/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">LFW3D and Adience3D sets</a></strong></li> 
            <li><strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://cvit.iiit.ac.in/projects/IMFDB/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Indian Movie Face database (IMFDB)</a></strong>&nbsp;-unconstrained face database consisting of 34512 images of 100 Indian actors</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.info.polymtl.ca/~mdhas/LWF/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Labeled Wikipedia Faces (LWF)</a></strong>&nbsp;– &nbsp;8.5k faces for about 1.5k identities</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.wilmabainbridge.com/facememorability2.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">10k US Adult Faces Database</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;10,168 natural face photographs</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://mohammadmahoor.com/databases/denver-intensity-of-spontaneous-facial-action/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Denver Intensity of Spontaneous Facial Action (DISFA) Database</a>&nbsp;stereo videos of 27 adults</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~lijun/Research/3DFE/3DFE_Analysis.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BU-3DFE Database (Static Data)</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;100 subjects with 2,500 facial expression models.</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~lijun/Research/3DFE/3DFE_Analysis.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BU-4DFE Database (Dynamic Data)</a>–&nbsp;&nbsp;606 3D facial expression sequences captured from 101 subjects, with a total of approximately 60,600 frame models.</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.cs.binghamton.edu/~lijun/Research/3DFE/3DFE_Analysis.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BP4D-Spontanous Database</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;41 participants (Each participant is associated with 8 tasks.</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://www.biometrics.dmcs.pl/en/databases" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DMCSv1 Database – </a>3D Face and Hand Scans</li> 
            <li><a class="main-link1" href="http://childstudycenter.rutgers.edu/Child_Affective_Facial_Expression_Set.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CAFE – The Child Affective Face Set-</a>&nbsp;1200 photographs 100 children 2-8) making 7 different facial expressions</li> 
            <li><strong>&nbsp;</strong><a class="main-link1" href="http://ufi.kiv.zcu.cz/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">UFI – Unconstrained Facial Images</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;images extracted from photographs of the Czech News Agency</li> 
           </ul> 
           <p><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="19217" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/ai-market/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg" data-orig-size="1490,1046" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="AI market" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=468&amp;h=329" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-19217" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=468&amp;h=329" alt="AI market" width="468" height="329" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=468&amp;h=329 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=936&amp;h=658 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=150&amp;h=105 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=300&amp;h=211 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/ai-market.jpg?w=768&amp;h=539 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <h3>Text Analysis Tools/Natural Language Platforms</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li id="6158" class="graf graf--p graf-after--h3"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="http://u.cs.biu.ac.il/~yogo/nnlp.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">A Primer on Neural Network Models for Natural Language Processing</a>&nbsp;– Yoav Goldberg</li> 
            <li id="d063" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://monkeylearn.com/blog/the-definitive-guide-to-natural-language-processing/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">The Definitive Guide to Natural Language Processing</a>&nbsp;– monkeylearn.com</li> 
            <li id="b2fc" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://blog.algorithmia.com/introduction-natural-language-processing-nlp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Introduction to Natural Language Processing</a>&nbsp;– algorithmia.com</li> 
            <li id="d6ba" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="http://www.vikparuchuri.com/blog/natural-language-processing-tutorial/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Natural Language Processing Tutorial</a>&nbsp;– vikparuchuri.com</li> 
            <li id="1d24" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/1103.0398.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Natural Language Processing (almost) from Scratch</a>&nbsp;– arxiv.org</li> 
            <li id="39ff" class="graf graf--p graf-after--h4"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://arxiv.org/pdf/1703.03091.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deep Learning applied to NLP</a>&nbsp;– arxiv.org</li> 
            <li id="c060" class="graf graf--p graf-after--p"><a class="markup--anchor markup--p-anchor" href="https://nlp.stanford.edu/courses/NAACL2013/NAACL2013-Socher-Manning-DeepLearning.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deep Learning for NLP (without Magic)</a>&nbsp;– Richard Socher</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.etcml.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>etcML</strong></a> – open source text analysis tool via machine learning algorithms</li> 
            <li><a href="http://nlp.stanford.edu/software/index.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>StanfordNLP</strong></a>&nbsp;– great list of language processing tools 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://nlp.stanford.edu/software/corenlp.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">coreNLP</a> – open source natural language processing analysis tool</li> 
              <li><a href="http://nlp.stanford.edu/software/lex-parser.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">StanfordParser</a> –&nbsp;natural language parser grammatical&nbsp;structure of sentences</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://gate.ac.uk" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>GATE</strong></a> – general architecture for text engineering</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/dennybritz/cnn-text-classification-tf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CNN for Text classification</strong></a> – using Tensorflow</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.cs.cornell.edu/people/pabo/movie-review-data/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Movie Review Data</strong></a> – for&nbsp;sentiment-analysis experiments</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.nltk.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>NLTK</strong></a> – Natural Language Toolkit build&nbsp;Python programs- interface to&nbsp;<a href="http://nltk.org/nltk_data/">over 50 corpora and lexical resources</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.cis.upenn.edu/~treebank/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Penn Treebank Project</strong></a> –&nbsp;annotates naturally-occuring text for linguistic structure 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC2008T19" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">NY Times Annotated Corpus</a> –&nbsp;1.8 million articles January 1, 1987 and June 19, 2007 with article metadata</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://googleresearch.blogspot.com/2013/03/learning-from-big-data-40-million.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Google Wikilinks Corpus</strong></a> –&nbsp;40 million total disambiguated mentions within over 10 million web pages</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://lemurproject.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Lemur Project</a> –</strong>&nbsp;text analysis tools, and data resources for R&amp;D&nbsp;of information retrieval and text mining software 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://lemurproject.org/indri.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Indri</a> – text search engine</li> 
              <li><a href="http://lemurproject.org/clueweb09.php/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ClueWeb09 Corpus</a></li> 
              <li><a href="http://lemurproject.org/clueweb12/FACC1/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ClueWeb12 Corpus</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.cortical.io" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Cortical.io</strong></a> – Natural Language platform</li> 
            <li><a href="http://idibon.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>idibon</strong></a> –&nbsp;Natural Language platform</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.luminoso.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Luminoso</strong></a> –&nbsp;Natural Language platform</li> 
            <li><a href="https://wit.ai" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>wit.ai</strong></a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Natural Language platform</li> 
            <li><a href="https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/LDC93S1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>TIMIT</strong></a> –&nbsp;Acoustic-Phonetic Continuous Speech Corpus</li> 
            <li><a href="https://wit.ai" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>wit.ai</strong></a> – natural language for developers</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.soundhound.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>soundhound</strong></a> – speech and music mobile app; “speech to meaning” API</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.agnitio-corp.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>agnitio</strong></a> – voice biometrics, speaker identification compant; speaker id in a box</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.expectlabs.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Expect Labs</strong></a> – Advanced AI for voice driven user interfaces</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.alchemyapi.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>AlchemyAPI</strong></a> – 12 Semantic Text Analysis APIs Using Natural Language Processing</li> 
            <li><strong style="line-height:1.5;"><a href="https://captricity.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Captricity</a></strong><span style="line-height:1.5;"> – crowd guided machine Document Image Processing</span></li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Social Mining</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="https://www.dataminr.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Dataminr</strong></a> – focused on Twitter streaming I&amp;W.&nbsp; limited to 14 day retro.</li> 
            <li><a href="http://topsy.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Topsy</strong></a> – Twitter&nbsp;search, monitoring and analytics</li> 
            <li><a href="https://socialcrawlytics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Social Crawlytics</strong></a> – user influencer and content marketing tool</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.metamind.io" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Metamind</strong></a> – deep-learning experts for sentiment</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Cyber/Behavioral/Threats</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><strong><u></u><a href="https://www.zerofox.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ZeroFox</a></strong> – harness social data to improve information security</li> 
            <li><a href="http://redowlanalytics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>RedOwl</strong></a> – behavioral analytics security software</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.harvest.ai" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>harvest.ai</strong></a> – find and stop attacks on your data</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.area1security.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Area 1 Security</strong></a> – combat spear-fishing attacks in a clever way</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.hyperiongray.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Hyperion Gray</strong></a> – mass fuzzing of the internet and darknet profiles</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.fireeye.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Fireeye</strong></a> – Cybersecurity and malware prevention –&nbsp;machine learning for intrusion detection</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.digitalstakeout.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Digital Stakeout</a></strong> – real time&nbsp;threat intelligence platform</li> 
           </ul> 
           <p><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="19308" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/cybersecurity/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg" data-orig-size="2043,1511" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="cybersecurity" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=468&amp;h=346" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-19308" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=468&amp;h=346" alt="cybersecurity" width="468" height="346" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=468&amp;h=346 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=936&amp;h=692 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=150&amp;h=111 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=300&amp;h=222 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cybersecurity.jpg?w=768&amp;h=568 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <h3>Geolocation</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://www.ccri.com/case-studies/geomesa/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>GeoMesa</strong></a>&nbsp;open-source system that stores, indexes, and queries hundreds of billions of geospatial features in a distributed database (<a href="https://accumulo.apache.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Accumulo</a>)</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://ngageoint.github.io/geowave/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">GeoWave</a></strong> leverages the scalability of a distributed key-value store for effective storage, retrieval, and analysis of massive geospatial datasets</li> 
            <li><a href="https://locationtech.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>LocationTech</strong></a> –&nbsp;working group developing advanced location aware technologies</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Physics Engines for games/robotics</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://box2d.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Box2D</strong></a> – 2d physics engine for games</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://bulletphysics.org/wordpress/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Bullet</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong>physics simulation engine</li> 
            <li><span style="color:#0000ee;"><b><u>ncollide</u></b></span>&nbsp;– 2D &amp; 3D collision library for the Rust language</li> 
            <li><a href="https://chipmunk-physics.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Chipmunk</strong></a>– 2D&nbsp;real-time rigid body&nbsp;physics&nbsp;engine</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://chronoengine.info/chronoengine/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chrono:Engine</a> – </strong>C++ simulation library</li> 
            <li><a href="https://farseerphysics.codeplex.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Farseer</strong></a> – based on Box2D w/collision detection</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.havok.com/products/physics" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Havok</strong></a> – collision detection and physics engine</li> 
            <li><a href="https://github.com/liabru/matter-js" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Matter.js</strong></a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;JavaScript 2D rigid body physics engine for the web</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.mataliphysics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Metali</strong></a> – 3D physics engine</li> 
            <li><a href="http://physsim.sourceforge.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><b>Moby</b></a>&nbsp;– multi-body dynamics simulation library written in C++</li> 
            <li><a href="http://newtondynamics.com/forum/newton.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Newton</strong></a> –&nbsp;life-like physics simulation library</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.ode.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Open Dynamics Engine</strong> </a>–&nbsp;library for simulating rigid body dynamics</li> 
            <li><a href="http://schteppe.github.io/p2.js/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>p2.js</strong></a> – JavaScript 2D physics library</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://pal.sourceforge.net/">Physics Abstraction Layer</a></strong>&nbsp;(PAL) –&nbsp;unified interface to a number of different physics engines</li> 
            <li><a href="http://wellcaffeinated.net/PhysicsJS/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>PhysicsJS</strong></a> –&nbsp;physics engine for&nbsp;javascript</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.opentissue.org/mediawiki/index.php/Main_Page" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>OpenTissue</strong></a> –&nbsp;algorithms and data structures for rapid development of interactive modeling and simulation</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.tokamakphysics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Tokamak</strong></a> – real time physics engine</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.trueaxis.com/physics/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TrueAxis</a> –&nbsp;</strong>real time physics engine</li> 
           </ul> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://proteustoolkit.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Proteus</strong></a> – A Python toolkit for toolkit for&nbsp;computational fluid and solid mechanics simulation</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Simulation/Game AI Engines</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://www.presagis.com/products_services/products/modeling-simulation/simulation/stage/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Stage</strong></a>&nbsp;–sophisticated simulation scenarios across massive gaming areas</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="external text" href="http://www.trusoft.com/ac_for_games_developers.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Artificial Contender</a></strong>&nbsp;– AI middleware for behavior-capture</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="external text" href="http://www.cyntient.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">Cyntient AI</a></strong>&nbsp;– AI middleware</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="external text" href="http://www.mak.com/products/humans.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">DI-Guy</a></strong>&nbsp;– human&nbsp;simulation software</li> 
            <li><a class="external text" href="http://gameware.autodesk.com/navigation" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><strong>Gameware</strong>&nbsp;</a>–&nbsp;AI&nbsp;middleware,&nbsp;NavMesh generation, hierarchical pathfinding, and path following</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.masalife.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Masa Life</strong></a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;AI&nbsp;middleware,&nbsp;design how characters behave and how they interact with the world</li> 
            <li><a href="http://rivaltheory.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Rain</strong></a>&nbsp;– AI&nbsp;character engine –&nbsp;behavior creation, automatic navigation mesh generation, and animation control</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="external text" href="http://www.simbionic.com/games.htm" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">SimBionic</a></strong>&nbsp;–&nbsp;create intelligent behavior for games and simulations</li> 
            <li><strong><a class="external text" href="http://www.spirops.com/products.php" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer">SpirOps</a></strong>&nbsp;–&nbsp;AI middleware for crowd simulations</li> 
            <li><a href="https://kerbalspaceprogram.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Kerbal</strong></a> – space program simulation</li> 
           </ul>

           <h3><strong>Cloud Services and Tools</strong></h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_hosting_service" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Web Hosting Tutorial</a></strong></li>

             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://appharbor.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">AppHarbor</a>&nbsp;– Heroku for .net</li> 
              <li><a href="https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/how-heroku-works" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">How Heroku Works</a></li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.cloudfoundry.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CloudFoundry</strong></a> – deploy and scale apps in seconds- open source Platform as a Service</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://aws.amazon.com/">Amazon Web Services</a></strong><strong>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong>Amazon’s cloud solution –&nbsp;Infrastructure as a Service 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://arstechnica.com/business/news/2012/03/cracking-the-cloud-an-amazon-web-services-primer.ars" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Amazon Web Services very basic p</a>rimer</li> 
              <li><a href="https://www.expeditedssl.com/aws-in-plain-english" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">AWS in plain english</a>&nbsp;– great guide to all AWS services</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
           </ul> 
           <div class="aws-col aws-tiny-6"> 
            <div class="aws-nav-mm-section"> 
             <div class="aws-nav-mm-section-header">
              <a href="https://aws.amazon.com/products/compute/?nc2=h_l3_db">Compute</a>
             </div> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/?nc2=h_m1">Amazon EC2</a>&nbsp;– virtual server hosting</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ecr/?nc2=h_m1">Amazon EC2 Container Registry</a>&nbsp;– Docker container registry</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ecs/?nc2=h_m1">Amazon EC2 Container Service</a>&nbsp;– Docker container mgmt.</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/?nc2=h_m1">AWS Elastic Beanstalk</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;deploy web apps developed with Java,&nbsp;<a href="https://aws.amazon.com/net/">.NET</a>, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, and&nbsp;<a href="https://aws.amazon.com/docker/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Docker</a>&nbsp;on Apache, Nginx, Passenger, and&nbsp;<a href="https://aws.amazon.com/windows/">IIS</a></li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/?nc2=h_m1">AWS Lambda</a>&nbsp;– pay as you go services</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/autoscaling/?nc2=h_m1">Auto Scaling</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;scale your&nbsp;<a href="https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Amazon EC2</a>&nbsp;capacity up or down automatically</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/?nc2=h_m1">Elastic Load Balancing</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;automatically distribute incoming app traffic across multiple Amazon EC2 instances</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/?nc2=h_m1">Amazon VPC</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;provision a logically isolated section of AWS cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.</li> 
              <li><a href="https://aws.amazon.com/server-migration-service/?nc2=h_m1">AWS Server Migration Service</a>&nbsp;– Migrate your on premises workloads to AWS</li> 
             </ul> 
            </div>
