           <h2 style="line-height:1.5em;">__________</h2> 
           <h2 id="marketresearch" style="line-height:1.5em;">Market Research Tools</h2> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="http://www.clipular.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Clipular</strong></a> – Camera for the web/great research clippings</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.d.umn.edu/~jvileta/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Business Research LaunchPad</a> </strong>– start here</li> 
            <li><a href="http://archive.org/web/web.php" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>WaybackMachine</strong></a> – archive of web pages from 1996 to today</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://archive.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">archive.org</a></strong>&nbsp;– digital library of old books, recordings, etc.</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.changedetection.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ChangeDetection</a></strong>&nbsp;– automatically know when any web page changes</li> 
           </ul> 
           <p style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Private “pay for market research” firms</strong></p> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="https://www.cbinsights.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CBInsights</strong></a> – best overall startup/vc data</li> 
            <li><span style="color:#333333;"><strong><a class="external_link external_link_tooltip" style="color:#19558d;" href="http://datamarketplace.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer"><span style="color:#333333;">DataMarketplace</span></a></strong></span></li> 
            <li><a href="https://datamarket.azure.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>WindowsAzure</strong></a> – Data Marketplace</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.gartner.com/technology/home.jsp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Gartner</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.forrester.com/rb/research/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Forrestor</a>,&nbsp;<a href="http://www.yankeegroup.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Yankee</a>&nbsp;– IT</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.frost.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Frost &amp; Sullivan</a> – mulitple industries</li> 
            <li><a href="http://npdinsider.npd.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">NPD</a> – entertainment</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.imshealth.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">IMSHealth</a> – &nbsp;health care</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.imshealth.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">MedMix</a> – lifesciences</li> 
            <li><a href="http://cmrhoutex.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CMR</a> – chemical</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.api.org/statistics/accessapi/index.cfm">API</a> – petroleum industry</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;">Datasets</h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><span style="line-height:13px;"><strong><a href="http://aws.amazon.com/datasets" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Amazon AWS</a></strong> – public crawl</span></li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.startupcompass.co" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>StartupCompass</strong></a> – benchmark your core business metrics</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://snap.stanford.edu/data/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Stanford Large Network Dataset</a></strong></li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;">U.S. State/Canada/Federal Open Data</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://www.data.gov/opendatasites#anchor" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">List of open government/country data sites</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong><strong>Start Here</strong></li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="https://code.gov/#/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Code.gov</strong></a> – Access U.S. gov’t open source code</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="https://www.usaspending.gov/Pages/Default.aspx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>USASpending</strong></a> – official US Gov’t site on where the money goes</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://usgovxml.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>U.S. government Web Service &amp; XML Data</strong></a> – Start Here as well</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://data.cacs.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>USCommonSense</strong></a> – US Open data portal</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="https://analytics.usa.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Analytics.usa.gov</strong></a> – the US Gov’ts web traffic</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://ci4ene04.ecn.purdue.edu/DIA2/pages/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">National Science Foundation</a></strong>&nbsp;–&nbsp; data mine any NSF award, person or institution</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2013/06/healthcaregov-code-developed-by-the-people-and-for-the-people-released-back-to-the-people/277295/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Building Healthcare.gov</a></strong></li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.fedstats.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>FedStats</strong></a>&nbsp;– data from 100 U.S. Federal agencies</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://research.stlouisfed.org/fred2/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Federal Reserve</strong></a> – U.S. economic data</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.sba.gov/about-sba-services/the-sba-website" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Small Business Administration</strong></a> – Data – <strong><a href="https://www.sba.gov/about-sba/sba-performance/sba-data-store/web-service-api" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">API</a>&nbsp;</strong>here</li>

            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://data.medicare.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Medicare Data</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;</strong>hospitals, physicians, nursing homes, dialysis, suppliers,etc</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.epa.gov/data/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Environmental Protection Agency</strong></a> (EPA) – &nbsp;air, water, climate, etc.</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://www.fda.gov/aboutfda/transparency/opengovernment/default.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FDA.gov</a>&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;med device tracking <strong><a href="http://www.fda.gov/aboutfda/centersoffices/officeofmedicalproductsandtobacco/cdrh/cdrhtransparency/ucm199915.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">here</a></strong></li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.archives.gov/research/alic/tools/online-databases.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>National Archives</strong></a> – everything the U.S. govt has in print</li>

           <h3>Solar &amp; Renewables Open Data</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.dsireusa.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DSIRE</strong></a> – Database of&nbsp;State Incentives for Renewables and Energy Efficiency</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.solarelectricpower.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SEPA</strong></a> – Solar Electric Power Association</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.seia.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>SEIA</strong></a> – Solar Energy Industries Association</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.ases.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ASES</strong></a> – American Solar Energy Society</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="https://climatedataguide.ucar.edu" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>NCAR</strong></a> – Climate data sets</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.reegle.info" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Reegle</strong></a> – Clean energy open portal</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.energystar.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>EnergyStar</strong></a> –&nbsp;<span style="color:#222222;">U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) program</span></li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://www.epa.gov/cleanenergy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Clean Energy</strong></a> –&nbsp;<span style="color:#222222;">U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) program</span></li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="http://energy.gov/eere/wind/wind-program" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DOE Wind Program</strong></a>&nbsp;– U.S. Dept of Energy</li> 
            <li style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong><a href="http://energy.gov/eere/sunshot/sunshot-initiative" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">DOE Solar Program</a></strong> –&nbsp;U.S. Dept of Energy</li> 
            <li><a href="http://energy.gov/eere/office-energy-efficiency-renewable-energy" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong><span style="line-height:1.5em;">DOE&nbsp;</span>Efficiency<span style="line-height:1.5em;">&nbsp;&amp; Renewables Program</span></strong></a><span style="line-height:1.5em;"> –&nbsp;U.S. Dept of Energy</span></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.afdc.energy.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DOE Alternate Fuels Program</strong></a> -U.S. Dept of Energy</li> 
            <li><a href="http://apps3.eere.energy.gov/greenpower/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>DOE Green Power Network</strong></a> –&nbsp;U.S. Dept of Energy</li> 
            <li><a href="http://apps1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/energyplus/weatherdata_about.cfm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Weather data</strong></a> – 2100 locations</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;">Other Governments Open Data</h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;">

           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;">Open Company Data/Stats/API</h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="https://www.lendingclub.com/info/download-data.action" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>LendingClub</strong></a>&nbsp;– stats on funding and loans</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.prosper.com/tools/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Prosper</strong></a> – Prosper funding data/API</li> 
            <li><span style="line-height:13px;"><strong><a href="https://bbyopen.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BBYOpen</a></strong> – Best Buy open product data/API</span></li> 
            <li><a href="http://ebayodata.cloudapp.net/docs" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>EbayOdata</strong></a> – Ebay open data/API</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.yelp.com/academic_dataset" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Yelp Academic Dataset</strong></a> – access&nbsp;250 closest businesses for 30 universities for students</li> 
            <li><a href="https://customers.reuters.com/developer/apis_tech.aspx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Reuters/Thompson</strong></a> – content API</li> 
            <li><a href="http://developer.nytimes.com/docs" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>New York Times</strong></a> – content API</li> 
            <li><a href="http://explorer.content.guardianapis.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>The Guardian</strong></a> – content API</li> 
            <li><a href="http://webscope.sandbox.yahoo.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Yahoo</strong></a> – data for students/academics</li> 
            <li><a href="http://blog.uber.com/2013/03/04/economics-of-car-ownership/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Uber</strong></a> – car cost of ownership<a href="http://income-statements.findthecompany.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>FindtheCompany: BestIncomeStatements</strong></a> – compare company income statements</li> 
            <li><a href="http://ipo.findthecompany.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>FindtheCompany: BestIPOs</strong></a> – compare company IPOs</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.findthedata.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FindtheData</a></strong> – general data</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Open Mapping</h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="http://getremix.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Remix</strong></a> – open data transit planning 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/?hl=en" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">General Transit Feed Specification</a> –&nbsp;common format for public transportation schedules &amp; GIS</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://www.openstreetmap.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OpenStreetMap</a></strong>&nbsp;– free open source map data</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/innovate/innovate-with-open-data.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">OrdnanceSurvey</a></strong> – UK open mapping data</li> 
            <li><a href="https://mapzen.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Mapzen</strong></a> – open source mapping tools 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/tangrams/tangram" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Tangram</a>&nbsp;– hackable mapping engine, real-time rendering of 2D and 3D maps</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/mapzen/vector-datasource" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Vector tiles</a> – generate real-time renderings of map data</li> 
              <li><a href="https://github.com/valhalla/valhalla-docs/blob/master/api-reference.md" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Valhalla Routing Service</a> –&nbsp;integrate routing and navigation into a web or mobile application</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.mapbox.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Mapbox</strong></a> – design &amp; publish maps</li> 
            <li><a href="http://mapnik.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Mapnik</strong></a> – geospatial visualization &amp; processing</li> 
            <li><a href="http://tilestache.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>TileStache</strong></a> –&nbsp;Python&nbsp;app&nbsp;that serves up map tiles based on rendered geographic data</li> 
            <li><a href="http://postgis.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>PostGIS</strong></a> –&nbsp;spatial&nbsp;database&nbsp;extender for&nbsp;<a href="http://postgresql.org/">PostgreSQL</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.usgs.gov/pubprod/maps.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>USGSMaps</strong></a> – maps &amp; imagery 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://raster.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/Orthoimagery/USGS_EROS_Ortho/ImageServer" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">USGS_EROS_Ortho</a> –&nbsp;orthorectified digital aerial photographs and satellite imagery</li> 
             </ul> </li> 
            <li><a href="http://mobac.sourceforge.net" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Mobile Atlas Creator</strong></a> –&nbsp;create offline atlases for GPS handhelds and cell phone apps</li> 
            <li><a href="http://topomapsapp.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>TopoMaps</strong></a> – USGS maps on iPhone</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3>Genomic/BioMed Data</h3> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://uswest.ensembl.org/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Ensemble</strong></a> – Genome browser</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://browser.1000genomes.org/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">1000 Genomes</a> –&nbsp;</strong><span style="color:#555555;">Ensembl v73 databases contain the majority of the&nbsp;</span><a class="constant" style="color:#000066;" href="http://ftp.1000genomes.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/ftp/phase1/analysis_results">1000 genomes phase1 variants</a></li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://jimwatsonsequence.cshl.edu" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Jim Watsons DNA sequence</a></strong></li> 
            <li><a href="http://crcns.org/data-sets" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>CRCNS</strong></a> – computational neuroscience data sets</li> 
           </ul>

           <h3 style="font-size:14px;line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Market Research Resources Online</strong></h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="http://www.clustermapping.us" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">U.S. Clusters</a> – find local clusters of innovation</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.findthecompany.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FindTheCompany</a>&nbsp;– corporate and organization data</li> 
            <li><a href="http://blog.flurry.com/bid/79595/Kaboom-iOS-and-Android-International-Installed-Base-Expansion" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">IOS / Android Market Size </a>– Installed base</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.crunchbase.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Crunchbase</a>&nbsp;– tech company/people database</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.edsurge.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Edsurge</a> – educational software</li> 
            <li><a href="http://istrategylabs.com/2014/01/3-million-teens-leave-facebook-in-3-years-the-2014-facebook-demographic-report/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Facebook demographics</a>&nbsp;– strategy labs</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.changedetection.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ChangeDetection</a> – know when any web page changes</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.Sec.gov/edgar.shtml" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SEC EDGAR</a> – research on public U.S. firms</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.MarketReseach.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">MarketReseach.com</a>&nbsp; – Retailer of private market research reports</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.ZapData.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ZapData.com</a> – Dun &amp; Bradstreet offers free statistical industry data</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.thomasnet.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Thomas</a> – find any company in any industry</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.BizStats.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">BizStats.com</a> – free business statistics and financial ratios</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.SBDCnet.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">SBDC</a>&nbsp;– National Information Clearinghouse of the U.S. Small Business Administration</li> 
            <li><a href="http://library.dialog.com/bluesheets/html/bl0114.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Encyclopedia of Associations</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.Census.gov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">U.S. Bureau of the Census</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.EASIdemographics.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">EASI</a> – estimated demographic statistics within a user-specified radii for any address</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.Claritas.com/MyBestSegments/Default.jsp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Claritas</a> – psychographic information and analysis of zip code areas</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.Standardandpoors.com/products-services/industry_surveys/en/us" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Standard and Poors</a> – Industry Surveys</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.trade.gov/mas/ian/tradestatistics/index.asp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">International Trade Statistics</a> –</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.nvca.org/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=344&amp;Itemid=103" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">NVCA</a> – venture capital industry data</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.pwcmoneytree.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PWC MoneyTree</a> – more venture capital data</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.americanchemistry.com/Jobs/EconomicStatistics/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chemical Industry data</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.fdanews.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">FDA News</a> – medical device and drug data/news</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.asymco.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Asymco</a> – great market intelligence blog</li> 
           </ul>

             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://a16z.com/2015/09/23/16-more-metrics" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">16 more startup Metrics</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;– Andreesen Horowitz</li>

           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;">Startups Data</h3> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="http://mattermark.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Mattermark</a> – quantifying company growth for startup investors</li> 
            <li><a href="https://www.compass.co" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Compass</a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Turn data into actionable insights</li> 
            <li><a href="https://angel.co" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">AngelList</a><strong>&nbsp;–</strong>&nbsp;connecting startups and angels</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Coworking Spaces</strong></h3>

             <h3>Building/Managing<strong>&nbsp;Your Board</strong></h3> 
             <ul> 
              <li><a href="http://www.kauffman.org/~/media/kauffman_org/research%20reports%20and%20covers/2014/05/primer_for_building_an_effective_board.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Building an Effective Board</a> – Kauffman Foundation (PDF)</li> 
              <li><a href="https://steveblank.com/2011/06/01/why-board-meetings-suck-–-part-1-of-2/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why board meetings suck Part 1</a> – steve blank</li> 
              <li><a href="https://steveblank.com/2011/06/02/reinventing-the-board-meeting-–-part-2-of-2-virtual-valley-ventures/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Why board meetings suck Part&nbsp;2</a>&nbsp;– steve blank 
               <ul> 
                <li><a href="https://www.launchpadcentral.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">LaunchPad Central</a><b><strong>&nbsp;</strong>– </b>share Bus Model Canvas/Customer Development progress</li> 
                <li><a href="https://seederboard.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Seederboard</a> – startup reporting dashboard</li> 
               </ul> </li> 
              <li><a href="https://steveblank.com/2013/07/09/dont-give-away-your-board-seats/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Don’t Give Away Your Board Seats</a> – steve blank</li> 
             </ul> 
             <h3><strong>Intellectual Property Advice</strong></h3>

              <li><a href="http://gust.com/angel-investing/startup-blogs/2011/12/22/nuts-and-bolts-of-intellectual-property/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">“Nuts and Bolts” of Intellectual Property</a>&nbsp;– Antone Johnson</li>

           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Founder Equity Issues</strong></h3> 
           <p style="text-align:center;"><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="16122" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/compensation/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg" data-orig-size="1354,885" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="Compensation" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=300&amp;h=196" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=468" class="size-medium wp-image-16122 aligncenter" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=300&amp;h=196" alt="Compensation" width="300" height="196" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=300&amp;h=196 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=600&amp;h=392 600w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/compensation.jpg?w=150&amp;h=98 150w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px"></a></p>

            <h3><strong>Web/Mobile/Marketplace Revenue Models</strong></h3> 
            <ul> 
             <li><a href="http://growth.tlb.org/#_.eyJ1bml0cyI6IndlZWsiLCJyZXYwIjo2MCwiZXhwMCI6MTYwMCwicmV2R3Jvd3RoIjowLjAyNSwiZXhwR3Jvd3RoIjowfQ==" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Startup Growth Calculator</a> – Trevor Blackwell – awesome</li>

             <li><a href="http://abovethecrowd.com/2013/04/18/a-rake-too-far-optimal-platformpricing-strategy/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Optimal Platform Pricing Strategies</a> – Bill Gurley</li> 
            </ul> 
            <p><img data-attachment-id="13774" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/commission-fees/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg" data-orig-size="1108,494" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="Commission Fees" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=468&amp;h=208" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-13774" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=468&amp;h=208" alt="Commission Fees" width="468" height="208" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=468&amp;h=208 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=933&amp;h=416 933w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=150&amp;h=67 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=300&amp;h=134 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2013/04/commission-fees.jpg?w=768&amp;h=342 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></p>

           <h2 id="ChinaMarket" style="line-height:1.5em;">China – Doing Business</h2> 
           <p><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="18183" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/china-ecosystem-2/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg" data-orig-size="1448,1450" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="china ecosystem" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=468&amp;h=469" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-18183" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=468&amp;h=469" alt="china ecosystem" width="468" height="469" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=468&amp;h=469 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=936&amp;h=938 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=150&amp;h=150 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=300&amp;h=300 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/china-ecosystem.jpg?w=768&amp;h=769 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;">

             </ul> </li>

             </ul> </li>

           </ul>

           <h4 style="font-size:14px;line-height:1.5em;"><b>China Blogs</b></h4> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><span style="line-height:13px;"><a href="http://sinocism.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Sinocism</strong></a> – if you read anything about China subscribe to this</span></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.chinalawblog.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ChinaLaw</strong></a> – great blog about legal issues of doing business in China</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.techinasia.com/category/start-up/?tag=china" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">TechInAsia</a></strong> – good China and other Asia coverage</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.allroadsleadtochina.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>AllRoadsLeadtoChina</strong></a> – China business analysis</li> 
            <li><a href="https://en.greatfire.org" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>GreatFire</strong></a> – online censorship in China</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.chinainternetwatch.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">China Internet Watch</a></strong> – covers China Internet Marketing and statistics</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.ministryoftofu.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>MinistryOfTofu</strong></a> – China Social Justice</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.chinafile.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ChinaFile</strong></a><strong> –&nbsp;</strong>Asia Society</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.jamestown.org/chinabrief/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>ChinaBrief</strong></a> – Jamestown Foundation</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://sinosphere.blogs.nytimes.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Sinosphere</a>&nbsp;</strong>– New York Times</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://shanghaiist.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Shanghiaiist</a></strong> – city blog</li> 
            <li><strong><a href="http://www.wantchinatimes.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">WantChina</a>Times</strong> – Taiwan’s view of the PRC</li> 
            <li><a href="http://carnegietsinghua.org/publications/?lang=en" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://carnegieendowment.org/2013/12/13/contradictions-in-china-s-foreign-policy/gw4w?utm_source=The+Sinocism+China+Newsletter&amp;utm_campaign=ca38b1394c-Sinocism12_15_13&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_term=0_171f237867-ca38b1394c-29602113" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Foreign Policy</a>&nbsp;– Carnegie Endowment</li>

           </ul> 
           <h4 style="font-size:14px;line-height:1.5em;">China Military Books/Blogs</h4> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a style="line-height:1.5em;" href="http://china-pla.blogspot.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chinese Air and Naval Power</a><span style="line-height:1.5em;">&nbsp;– blog</span></li> 
            <li><a style="line-height:1.5em;" href="http://bos.sagepub.com/content/69/6/79" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chinese Nuclear Forces 2013</a><span style="line-height:1.5em;">&nbsp;– Bulletin of Atomic Scientists</span></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1591142415/ref=as_li_tf_tl?ie=UTF8&amp;tag=wwwsteveblank-20&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;camp=217145&amp;creative=399373&amp;creativeASIN=1591142415" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chinese Aerospace Power</a>&nbsp;– Andrew S. Erickson &amp; Lyle J. Goldstein</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1591140803/ref=as_li_tf_tl?ie=UTF8&amp;tag=wwwsteveblank-20&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=9325&amp;creativeASIN=1591140803" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Peoples Liberation Army Navy</a>: Combat Systems Technology, 1949-2010</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.fas.org/sgp/crs/row/RL33153.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">China Naval Modernization</a>: Implications for U.S. Navy Capabilities—Background and Issues for Congress</li> 
           </ul> 
           <h2>Japan – Doing Business</h2> 
           <ul> 
            <li><a href="http://www.kalzumeus.com/2014/11/07/doing-business-in-japan/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Doing a startup/business in Japan</a>&nbsp;– Kalzumeus – Awesome post</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/starting-business-in-japan.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">starting a business in Japan</a>&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/starting-japanese-company.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">setting up in Japan</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/japanese-distributors.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Japanese distributors</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/direct-sales-in-japan.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">direct sales in Japan</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/fast-track-sales-japan-3.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">secrets of success</a> – Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/japan-business-culture-meeting.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">business meetings in Japan</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.venturejapan.com/japanese-business-etiquette.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Japanese business etiquette</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;– Venture Japan</li> 
           </ul> 
           <p style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong style="font-size:1.17em;line-height:1.5em;">Must Read Blogs</strong></p> 
           <p style="line-height:1.5em;"><a href="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg"><img data-attachment-id="18246" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/venture-blogs/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg" data-orig-size="1334,848" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="venture blogs" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=468&amp;h=297" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-18246" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=468&amp;h=297" alt="venture blogs" width="468" height="297" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=468&amp;h=297 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=934&amp;h=594 934w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=150&amp;h=95 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=300&amp;h=191 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/venture-blogs.jpg?w=768&amp;h=488 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></a></p> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><a href="http://www.businessinsider.com/20-blogs-every-entrepreneur-should-read-2011-4#" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Best Blogs Every Entrepreneur</a>&nbsp;should read</li> 
            <li><a href="https://mentorphile.com/blog/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>Mentorphile</strong></a>&nbsp;–&nbsp;Steve Bayle a mentor, from&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href="http://vms.mit.edu/">MIT Venture Mentoring Service</a></li>

            <li><a href="http://blog.jedchristiansen.com/2009/10/15/a-marc-andreessen-blog-archive/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Marc Andreessen</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://paulgraham.com/articles.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Paul Graham</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://news.ycombinator.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Hacker News</a></li> 
            <li><a href="http://www.feld.com/wp/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Brad Feld</a></li>

           <h2 style="line-height:1.5em;"><img data-attachment-id="20952" data-permalink="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/cannibis-market/" data-orig-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png" data-orig-size="3841,2008" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Cannibis market" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=468&amp;h=245" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-20952" src="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=468&amp;h=245" alt="Cannibis market" width="468" height="245" srcset="https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=468&amp;h=245 468w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=936&amp;h=490 936w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=150&amp;h=78 150w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=300&amp;h=157 300w, https://steveblank.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/cannibis-market.png?w=768&amp;h=401 768w" sizes="(max-width: 468px) 100vw, 468px"></h2>

            <li><a href="https://vimeo.com/groups/213077/videos/85420010">Telling a Great Story</a> (13:16) UCSF</li> 
           </ol> 
           <h3 style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Misc</strong></h3> 
           <p style="line-height:1.5em;">Some of the material I have created or use in my classes does not lend itself to blogs. It’s more reference material. Thus, these pages.&nbsp; I’ll add more as time goes on. <a href="https://steveblank.com/slides/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><strong>See my slide/video links</strong></a></p> 
           <ul style="line-height:1.5em;"> 
            <li><em><strong>UC Berkeley, Haas Business School </strong></em><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/spring-2009-mba-295f-syllabus1/" target="_blank" rel="attachment wp-att-93 noopener noreferrer">Customer Development: Spring 2011 MBA 295F syllabus</a></li> 
            <li><em><strong>Stanford University </strong></em><a href="http://e245.stanford.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Engr</a><a href="http://e245.stanford.edu/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"> 245 – The Lean Launchpad</a></li> 
            <li><strong><a href="https://steveblank.com/slides/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Class slides</a></strong></li> 
           </ul> 
           <p style="line-height:1.5em;"><strong>Tenacity</strong> If you’ve gotten this far, here is a visual representation of&nbsp;<a href="https://www.dropbox.com/s/7hh55ult1io475l/Timelapse%201%20-%20Large%20Final.mov" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">tenacity</a> and persistenc</p>

I wanted to ask you what you thought about “context” ? I.e a lot is written in general terms, mostly US centric. What about emerging economies, what caveats do they posses ? Also do you agree with the notion of Entrepreneurship as “opportunity recognition” ?</p>

             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>I enjoyed your book and I found it helped me connect a lot of dots which now make more sense!</p> 
             <p>Most of the examples you cite in the book are targeted on highlighting challenges faced by each of the respective companies. I was wondering if you have a couple of examples of companies that have utilized your methodology and enjoyed great market success crossing the chasm and becoming successful mission-centric companies from start ups? </p> 
             <p>Any examples would be greatly appreciated!</p> 
             <p>Thank you.</p>

               <p>Greg,<br> The Google Group “Lean Startup Circle” at <a href="http://groups.google.com/group/lean-startup-circle" rel="nofollow">http://groups.google.com/group/lean-startup-circle</a> is a wonderful repository of Customer Development/Lean Startup success and failure.<br> In addition they have started a “Lean Startup Wiki” with the beginnings of a Case Study section here: <a href="http://leanstartup.pbworks.com/" rel="nofollow">http://leanstartup.pbworks.com/</a><br> If you email the group you’ll get plenty of responses.</p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-1880"> 
            <div id="div-comment-1880"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d5439eba4c17141f6ddea591db4eef4f?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Luke Lockhart</strong>, on <a href="#comment-1880" title="">November 13, 2009 at 2:01 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hello Steve,</p> 
             <p>I am currently reading The Four Steps to the Epiphany. The granular, tactical process that is laid out is amazing. I’ve experienced working for companies that did it the wrong way and one that went through the “death spiral” just as you describe. This thoroughly instilled in me that some sort of process more akin to yours must be the way to go. But until reading his book and blog I hadn’t known the exact steps to take and in which order.</p> 
             <p>Are there digital copies of some of the worksheets and checklists in the appendix of your book available in digital format? These would be extremely useful in getting buy-in and working collaboratively through the process across our founding team.</p> 
             <p>Thanks and Regards,</p> 
             <p>Luke L.<br> – Waterloo, Ontario</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-1880" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=1880&amp;_wpnonce=a47e62f6a9" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-1880" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p>

              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=1880#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-1880&quot;, &quot;1880&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Luke Lockhart">Reply</a>

           <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-1918"> 
            <div id="div-comment-1918"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/3b1410517e5a87a1703229b4704d3f45?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.LocalBooking.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Damien Rottemberg</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-1918" title="">November 19, 2009 at 6:31 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>I wish I had discovered your book earlier. It became my bible (after the real one ? to develop my company LocalBooking. I think this is perfect for it.</p> 
             <p>I wish I could have you as a consultant to help my company to take off. I am still trying to figure out the right market and customers for it.</p>

             <p>Awesome resources! Thanks. </p>

             <p>Steve, Very interesting list of resources. Thanks!</p> 
             <p>What about Django <a href="http://djangoproject.com" rel="nofollow">http://djangoproject.com</a> as Web Development Framework?</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-8723" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=8723&amp;_wpnonce=137f6f25a6" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-8723" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

           <!-- #comment-## --> 
           <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-8726"> 
            <div id="div-comment-8726"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8e2b996de3842c6ef7e68a82fa5f01f5?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Dan Croak</strong>, on <a href="#comment-8726" title="">February 28, 2011 at 6:39 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Here’s a few that are central to my work.</p> 
             <p>Billing/Subscription Management:</p> 
             <p>Braintree <a href="http://www.braintreepaymentsolutions.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.braintreepaymentsolutions.com</a> – Payment gateway, merchant account, and recurring billing all in one. Known for their great customer service.</p> 
             <p>Web Development Tools:</p> 
             <p>Sendgrid <a href="http://sendgrid.com" rel="nofollow">http://sendgrid.com</a> – Sends transactional email (signed up, forgot password, notifications) on behalf of you application. High deliverability rates.</p> 
             <p>Hoptoad <a href="http://hoptoadapp.com" rel="nofollow">http://hoptoadapp.com</a> – Collects production application errors, groups them so developers can see one backtrace and how many times the error occurred.</p> 
             <p>Blogs (VC):</p> 
             <p>Antonio Rodriguez <a href="http://theonda.org/" rel="nofollow">http://theonda.org/</a> – A very technical VC at Matrix partners who can actually code.</p> 
             <p>Blogs (web development):</p> 
             <p>Giant Robots Smashing Into Other Giant Robots – <a href="http://robots.thoughtbot.com" rel="nofollow">http://robots.thoughtbot.com</a> Company blog of thoughtbot covering Ruby on Rails, HTML, CSS, Javascript, databases, and mobile development.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-8726" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=8726&amp;_wpnonce=fca6748ed7" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-8726" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=8726#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-8726&quot;, &quot;8726&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Dan Croak">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>

              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1c03f22d529846080a81ef00442a6707?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.DataDOcExpress.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Steve Kohlenberger</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-8737" title="">February 28, 2011 at 3:25 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Steve,</p> 
             <p>Love your book! Super list.</p> 
             <p>Microsoft’s WebMatrix (<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/web/webmatrix/" rel="nofollow">http://www.microsoft.com/web/webmatrix/</a>) tries to seamlessly combine many public web development tools (like dotNetNuke, BlogEngine, WordPress, Drupal, Joomla, Umbraco, …) in one place on Windows for deployment on your choice of providers for $2.99/mo and up. (I don’t work for Microsoft nor an ISP).</p> 
             <p>For Freelance Help, consider adding:<br> Freelancer.com</p> 
             <p>Logo Design:<br> <a href="http://logoyes.com/" rel="nofollow">http://logoyes.com/</a></p> 
             <p id="comment-like-8737" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=8737&amp;_wpnonce=1e6a35559b" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-8737" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-8868"> 
            <div id="div-comment-8868"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2f061798b85587eabef6808c65e06fd0?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.markify.com/" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Benoit Fallenius</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-8868" title="">March 8, 2011 at 11:45 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>“Name, Domain name and Trademark” is a complex topic that, right or wrong, take a lot of time for entrepreneurs in the beginning. It should be added to this great list.<br> A new tool that will help the entrepreneur in the trademark issue is Markify – a trademark search that finds all similar trademarks. It covers both Europe ant the US, it is easy, fast and free. This kind of search normally costs more than $500…<br> Test your name <a href="http://www.markify.com/" rel="nofollow">http://www.markify.com/</a> so you don’t end up with a name that is confusingly similar to an existing trademark.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-8868" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=8868&amp;_wpnonce=db6b6100d5" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-8868" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=8868#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-8868&quot;, &quot;8868&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Benoit Fallenius">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>

             <p>May I humbly also suggest under the “freelance” category, my own site: vWorker.com? It has better protections than Elance (100% free money back guarantees) and the same timecard monitoring as oDesk but is cheaper by 10-35%:</p> 
             <p><a href="https://www.vworker.com/RentACoder/DotNet/misc/CompetitorInformation/WhyRentACoder_ForBuyers.aspx" rel="nofollow">https://www.vworker.com/RentACoder/DotNet/misc/CompetitorInformation/WhyRentACoder_ForBuyers.aspx</a></p>

             <p id="comment-like-10344" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=10344&amp;_wpnonce=cd415fc049" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-10344" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p>

              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=10344#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-10344&quot;, &quot;10344&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Erick">Reply</a>

             <p>Impressive list, but missing a key ingredient: Sales management tools. I think actually actively selling your stuff is very important for a startup these days. No-brainer for B2B companies but also for B2C companies (making special advertising deals for example)</p>

             <li class="comment byuser comment-author-steveblank bypostauthor even depth-2 parent highlander-comment" id="comment-11481">

               <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
                <div class="avatar">
                 <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/bb078b89e9979442056262311f9d21c2?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">

               <p>Martin,</p> 
               <p>Any suggestions?</p> 
               <p>steve</p> 
               <p id="comment-like-11481" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=11481&amp;_wpnonce=30654e5e93" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-11481" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p> 
               <div class="reply"> 
                <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=11481#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-11481&quot;, &quot;11481&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to steveblank">Reply</a> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <ul class="children"> 
               <li class="comment odd alt depth-3 highlander-comment" id="comment-11722">

                 </div> 
                 <p>I agree that help with sales is key for startups. I have found the step by step guideline of Kellogg Prof. Mohan Sawhney very helpful in clarifying the value proposition &amp; positioning and crafting the messaging. It is a process supported by a set of videos, tools and templates.</p> 
                 <p id="comment-like-11722" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=11722&amp;_wpnonce=4a361203de" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-11722" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

           <li class="comment byuser comment-author-techstartupceo even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-11728"> 
            <div id="div-comment-11728"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/67b2a175f73da441e18c0958b09158a1?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://techstartupgame.wordpress.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">techstartupceo</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-11728" title="">June 21, 2011 at 10:45 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>Really enjoy your book and blog – thanks for your insights. I have a question though, how do you suggest moving through the customer development process when you are developing a product that you want to keep under wraps until its release (and thus maintain your market advantage)? My R&amp;D company has a product in the works that we plan to sell to an existing customer base – but I’m challenged by how we engage these customers in the early design phases without letting the cat of the bag!</p> 
             <p>Thanks in advance for your insights —</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-11728" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=11728&amp;_wpnonce=0da232e693" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-11728" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

             <p>At Unboxed Consulting we use Xero.com, a SAAS accounting package and <a href="http://www.fatfreecrm.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.fatfreecrm.com</a>, an open-source Ruby-on-Rails CRM solution. Both are great for those first 1000 customers.</p>

             <p>I would recommend My eStore App ( <a href="http://www.myestoreapp.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.myestoreapp.com</a> ) it let’s new startup’s add ecommerce directly on your site for free and set up only takes 5 minutes. No coding required; works similar to google analytics. </p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-12476"> 
            <div id="div-comment-12476"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8fd2eac1f5c015066c62196d38a5f7f2?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.webplanner.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Sophia</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-12476" title="">August 3, 2011 at 6:55 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>I looked around but couldn’t find a good way to contact you. I work for Experience In Software, a small Berkeley-based company that’s been producing acclaimed business software since 1983. (Perhaps you’re familiar with Project KickStart?)</p> 
             <p>Yesterday we launched a brand-new project management application called Webplanner. I’m sure you’re very busy, but I wanted to invite you to give it a try. We’d be delighted to hear your thoughts: <a href="http://www.webplanner.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.webplanner.com</a></p> 
             <p>Thanks for your time.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-12476" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=12476&amp;_wpnonce=75b4f02cbd" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-12476" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=12476#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-12476&quot;, &quot;12476&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Sophia">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>

           <li class="pingback even thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-13570"> 
            <div id="div-comment-13570"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar"></div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.startupmonthly.org/2011/09/20/tools-and-technologies-that-you-can-use-for-rapid-prototyping/" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Tools and technologies that you can use for rapid prototyping | Startup Monthly Idea Accelerator</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-13570" title="">September 20, 2011 at 1:41 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>[…] Tools and technologies that you can use for rapid prototyping By yuri On September 20, 2011 · Leave a Comment Tweet Hello Accelerators, After pivoting and changing your idea in the last 2 weeks, now is the time to focus all your efforts towards you Minimal Viable Product. We have 4 weeks left till the Demo Day on October 16th. We are here to help you to succeed both on the Business Model side and the technology side. Most of the teams were assigned to a mentor that will lead them till the Demo day and make sure that you are on the right track in terms of the business model and that you are focused and know what do you want to implement for initial launch. We are going to be very strict and make sure that each of the teams will have live products. Remember that the faster you get live the faster you will get feedback from your customers and pivot if necessary. As a result, we will allow teams with live products only to present to a panel of investors. In order to be ready for the final you will have to prototype your MVP (Focus on the key feature that will make your customer to come back and use your product again), launch it, market it to your target customers, define metrics, collect metrics and statistics, analyze the metrics and&nbsp;refine your pitch deck (we will provide a template that you will need to fill), show traction to panel of investors. Remember that the panel of investors are looking at team&nbsp;cohesiveness, previous experience, ability to execute, show traction, social proof, business model and your target market. As most of you already started creating wireframes and the coding efforts I strongly recommend to use these tools and services: One of the complete sources of tools for startups is shown by Steve Blank in&nbsp;his blog post […]</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-13570" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=13570&amp;_wpnonce=dcf709103a" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-13570" class="comment-like-feedback">Like</span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=13570#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-13570&quot;, &quot;13570&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tools and technologies that you can use for rapid prototyping | Startup Monthly Idea Accelerator">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>
           <!-- #comment-## --> 
           <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 parent highlander-comment" id="comment-13585"> 
            <div id="div-comment-13585"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://i1.wp.com/graph.facebook.com/838673017/picture?q=type%3Dlarge%26_md5%3Deabfd061fa6b1f039e966cd348ae6b4f&amp;resize=32%2C32" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.facebook.com/george.p.stathis" rel="external nofollow" class="url">George P. Stathis</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-13585" title="">September 21, 2011 at 2:41 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>There seems to be tremendous response to such startup tools lists, both here and in the lists linked at the top of the page. The reputation of the source recommending the tools obviously has a lot to do with it. Would there be any interest in organizing this in some sort of community curated directory? Tools might make the list based on some entry criteria: e.g. two or more sources that have used or read them recommend they get mentioned. Some benefits are that it would be searchable and discussions / testimonials could be organized around each recommendation, helping potential users/readers to get a better idea of what to expect. There is a LOT to select from here, so the community could help make the selection process smoother.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-13585" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=13585&amp;_wpnonce=be55da1d23" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-13585" class="comment-like-feedback">Like</span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=13585#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-13585&quot;, &quot;13585&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to George P. Stathis">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div>

             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/aa8c050b1e41b88da5709843b1f6f879?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://blogmutt.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Scott Yates</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-14111" title="">October 10, 2011 at 7:36 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>One other new addition is the blog writing service Blogmutt. “We work like a dog to fill up your blog!”</p> 
             <p>This is a service for companies with a site and a blog that is always the last thing that gets done, and it ends up being weeks and months between posts. For a low, flat fee Blogmutt uses a crowd of writers to create all-original posts.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-14111" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=14111&amp;_wpnonce=22a9b5b4b5" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-14111" class="comment-like-feedback">Like</span></p>

             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/726d588eb49186fc439f190ac9968af1?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.plimus.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Leore</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-15337" title="">November 1, 2011 at 4:12 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>Great list of resources here!</p> 
             <p>As an additional resource for “Billing/Subscription Management/E-Store”, I thought your readers would be interested in Plimus. We offer a global e-Commerce platform for sellers and affiliates who sell digital goods and services online. </p> 
             <p>Our platform supports several subscription models (from different trials to dynamic subscriptions) and has all the tools needed to help manage them.</p> 
             <p>Our site is: <a href="http://www.plimus.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.plimus.com</a> (and it’s free to sign up).</p> 
             <p>Regards,<br> Leore</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-15337" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=15337&amp;_wpnonce=81484ff921" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-15337" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=15337#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-15337&quot;, &quot;15337&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Leore">Reply</a>

             </div> 
             <p>Great set of startup tools Steve.<br> I’ve been referring to the list for quite some time now to build my own company, and waiting for the time we are ready to shamelessly suggest our own product – JobPage – <a href="http://www.jobpage.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.jobpage.com</a></p> 
             <p>We provide many of the benefits of Recruiterbox and the Resumator, but we specialise in tech and marketing recruitment only. Our platform also pro-actively seeks out suitable candidates before they’ve even applied to one of our jobs.</p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-18821"> 
            <div id="div-comment-18821"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ba86eca1f1e7776d26301c3d257c2109?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.ThePoised.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Thom Holland</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-18821" title="">December 2, 2011 at 6:15 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Incredible list for entrepreneurs.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-18821" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=18821&amp;_wpnonce=c788dc875e" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-18821" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=18821#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-18821&quot;, &quot;18821&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Thom Holland">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-19154"> 
            <div id="div-comment-19154"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/ddc7a0ee47398517803ff10f11645353?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://gravatar.com/ngowdy" rel="external nofollow" class="url">ngowdy</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-19154" title="">December 7, 2011 at 1:57 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hey Steve – this is a brilliant list that I find myself coming back to time and again when tasked with, “Hey – Nick, find us a vendor for X.” It’s an easy way to get a who’s-who in each of these verticals, and we’ve been pretty happy with the vendors we’ve found (MailChimp, UserTesting.com, ClickTale, countless others).</p> 
             <p>I use this frequently enough that I think it would be terrific if you would consider our business for this list – FreedomVoice (<a href="http://www.freedomvoice.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.freedomvoice.com</a>). We’ve been in business since 1996, providing small businesses, startups, and entrepreneurs with 800 numbers and virtual phone service. We’ve recently branched into hosted VoIP telephony as well (www.freedomiq.com), a natural extension for growing businesses.</p> 
             <p>Maybe we could find a home under the “Misc Office Help” area – alongside vendors like Grasshopper or RingCentral?</p> 
             <p>Either way, my shame all-but-expunged, I just want to thank you for this is a ridiculously extensive, valuable, and constantly fresh list.</p> 
             <p>Go Bears.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-19154" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=19154&amp;_wpnonce=f7bf377e21" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-19154" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata">

               <img alt="" src="https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/e0c9e15637351fa6911bba11d2452da9?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F2.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.jflc-innovations.fr" rel="external nofollow" class="url">LEGAY Jean-François</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-20254" title="">December 23, 2011 at 4:14 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,<br> I read the french translation of your book “the 4 steps to epiphanie”.<br> The content appeared to me of great value for companies willing to put on the market successfull new products.<br> Nevertheless the french translation is very poor and appears offently as coming directly from a translating machine without necessary corrections or interpretations. This should make the content difficult to digest for non expertised persons.<br> Best regards and congratulations for your expertise.</p> 
             <p>Jean-François</p>
