           <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-23434"> 
            <div id="div-comment-23434"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/f8e8585f8f6a4cc14e38def75a3b9bd4?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Tim Waters</strong>, on <a href="#comment-23434" title="">February 21, 2012 at 9:14 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Excellent resources Steve, entrepreneurs will find this very helpful. I also bookmark this one on delicious. I believe that in order to be a successful entrepreneur you will need the right online tools and resources that can help you run your business smoothly and hassle free to progress. With these tools it can help you manage your business effectively and efficiently. You can also check this for more alternative tools that are very useful for entrepreneur to use. (<a href="http://www.timedoctor.com/blog/2011/04/14/compare-screen-monitoring-software" rel="nofollow">http://www.timedoctor.com/blog/2011/04/14/compare-screen-monitoring-software</a>) Using these tools it can help you improve collaboration, project management and team communication.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-23434" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=23434&amp;_wpnonce=a15e45b822" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-23434" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=23434#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-23434&quot;, &quot;23434&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Tim Waters">Reply</a> 
             </div> 
            </div> </li>

              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/980f33238f105975c4bb7195c4cd5588?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">

              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Tom G</strong>, on <a href="#comment-27376" title="">May 14, 2012 at 6:07 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>As far as I can see, the survey sites are all American. As usual.</p> 
             <p>Let me just throw in a European survey website in just in case any other people are looking for a site that complies with the Data Protection Act rather than a mixture of laws combined.</p> 
             <p><a href="http://www.smart-survey.co.uk" rel="nofollow">http://www.smart-survey.co.uk</a></p> 
             <p>They’re not too assimilar to Survey Monkey, except they’re UK based and slightly more user friendly.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-27376" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=27376&amp;_wpnonce=4766236dcc" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-27376" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-27826"> 
            <div id="div-comment-27826"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/40279d8156dbc87736ed2aa808d47b08?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">

              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Manoj</strong>, on <a href="#comment-27826" title="">May 22, 2012 at 9:13 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hey Steve, that’s a pretty comprehensive list of tools. I would suggest another great customer support tool, <a href="http://happyfox.com" rel="nofollow">HappyFox</a>. Its visual appeal, sophisticated design, impressive organizational capabilities and intuitive interface make it a standout tool. Give it a shot!</p>

             <p>Such a huge list!! – I’d recommend checking out <a href="http://www.onedesk.com" rel="nofollow">OneDesk</a> for project management , help desk and collaboration needs – </p>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-34067"> 
            <div id="div-comment-34067"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/02e73fca23466162bdf41ae797c5b536?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://myfirstwebsitetutorial.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Website Tutorial</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-34067" title="">August 18, 2012 at 12:27 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>This is honestly one of the most complete and comprehensive list of startup tools I have ever seen. The only part that threw me off was in reference to the web hosting/cloud services portions. I would imagine that most developers already have a rock solid foundation in regard to what web hosting is and who they should be using.</p> 
             <p>That being said, if the target reader for those links is someone who simply needs a business website up ASAP, I think the links could be slightly improved upon. Most importantly the website setup/tutorial and the web hosting tutorial links.</p> 
             <p>I created a site to address this need, which you can find at <a href="http://myfirstwebsitetutorial.com" rel="nofollow">http://myfirstwebsitetutorial.com</a></p> 
             <p>My goal with the site is to make it incredibly simple for a new business owner to put up a high quality site in less than hour with absolutely no amount of coding knowledge. It is still a work in progress, and feedback is of course welcome.</p> 
             <p>Steve, please let me know if there is anything I can do to make my website worthy of your resources page. And please keep blogging!! Your blog posts are by far the most well written and inspiring of any entrepreneurial blogger.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-34067" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=34067&amp;_wpnonce=09c01ba472" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-34067" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

             <p id="comment-like-34452" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=34452&amp;_wpnonce=a1db9c90f4" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-34452" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p> 
             <div class="reply"> 
              <a rel="nofollow" class="comment-reply-link" href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?replytocom=34452#respond" onclick="return addComment.moveForm( &quot;div-comment-34452&quot;, &quot;34452&quot;, &quot;respond&quot;, &quot;22&quot; )" aria-label="Reply to Mike Panesis">Reply</a> 
             </div>

           <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 highlander-comment" id="comment-34841"> 
            <div id="div-comment-34841"> 
             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/65509e5861fb7c90e81fe9dadb329d37?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://www.swift-kanban.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Mahesh Singh</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-34841" title="">August 28, 2012 at 3:19 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi Steve,</p> 
             <p>Awesome list of tools here. Please consider adding Swift-Kanban (<a href="http://swift-kanban.com" rel="nofollow">http://swift-kanban.com</a>) to the list of Project Management and collaboration tools. Designed and built under guidance from David J Anderson, father of the Kanban Method for software, it is being widely considered one of the top Kanban tools.</p> 
             <p>Thanks!<br> Mahesh Singh<br> Co-founder, Digite, Inc.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-34841" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=34841&amp;_wpnonce=795d40ce04" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-34841" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="2">2 people</a></span></p>

             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/6c9764b68695504c298a4092156ff2e1?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F0.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn">Rene</strong>, on <a href="#comment-36493" title="">September 19, 2012 at 5:14 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Hi,</p> 
             <p>I suggest Breeze (<a href="http://letsbreeze.com" rel="nofollow">http://letsbreeze.com</a>), it’s a simple tool for agile project management.<br> Based on lean and agile principles (Kanban, Scrum). It’s kind a hybrid between Trello and Basecamp but adds more functionality that suites consultants and small businesses, mainly time tracking and reporting.</p> 
             <p>Regards,<br> Rene</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-36493" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=36493&amp;_wpnonce=5490812fa4" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-36493" class="comment-like-feedback">Liked by <a href="#" class="view-likers" data-like-count="1">1 person</a></span></p>

             <p>This is just a terrific list of tools and resources, wonder how much effort was put into it, kudos.</p> 
             <p>I’d love to recommend one of my favorites, ClickDesk – <a href="http://www.clickdesk.com/" rel="nofollow">http://www.clickdesk.com/</a> for live chat and helpdesk to be added to customer support/feedback list.</p> 
             <p>And, of course I love the likes of Mailchimp, Dropbox and Basecamp already on the list. You could also add Workflowy for project management and to-do lists.</p> 
             <p>Cheers and thanks again for the list!</p>

             </div> 
             <p>Steve, great post! For those in need of a scalable content creation solution, I co-founded scripted.com. I also wrote this for Techcrunch recently, so wanted to pass it along (advice on raising seed capital from a founder’s perspective): <a href="http://techcrunch.com/2012/05/13/how-to-raise-1m-seed-round/" rel="nofollow">http://techcrunch.com/2012/05/13/how-to-raise-1m-seed-round/</a>.              <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar"></div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://tekedia.com/46741/some-knowledge-hacks-for-african-startup-founders-and-entrepreneurs/" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Tekedia » Some Knowledge Hacks for African Startup Founders and Entrepreneurs</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-41639" title="">November 19, 2012 at 4:22 am</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>[…] Steve Blank’s Startup Tools […]</p>

             <p>Steve, perhaps you might consider in your Lists of Tools from Others or another section, our Finance Toolkit for Startups. We have a range of tools that will grow monthly and includes Sample Pitch Decks, a Board Meeting Agenda, and a Cap Table.              <p>Hey Steve,</p>

             <p>Hi Steve,<br> Have you considered adding a category for creative services, specifically explainer/demo videos for startups? They could be considered marketing tools, but perhaps there could be a creative category.</p> 
             <p><a href="http://DunkTank.co" rel="nofollow">http://DunkTank.co</a> does startup demo videos as well as things like slide design, logo animations, and original audio. </p>

             <div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"> 
              <div class="avatar">
               <img alt="" src="https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/de647062ea4beecfbddba5737fd4365a?s=32&amp;d=https%3A%2F%2F1.gravatar.com%2Favatar%2Fad516503a11cd5ca435acc9bb6523536%3Fs%3D32&amp;r=G" class="avatar avatar-32" height="32" width="32">
              </div> 
              <span class="comment-author vcard"><strong class="fn"><a href="http://reviewsignal.com" rel="external nofollow" class="url">Kevin Ohashi</a></strong>, on <a href="#comment-43188" title="">December 6, 2012 at 3:48 pm</a> said: </span> 
             </div> 
             <p>Steve – I wanted to suggest <a href="http://reviewsignal.com/webhosting" rel="nofollow">http://reviewsignal.com/webhosting</a> for your website setup category. It’s a review site based on what people are saying about web hosting companies on social media. It’s designed to be transparent (each review is sourced to the social media account it was posted on) and all the ranking info is public. It’s our startup’s attempt to introduce honest and transparent reviews for the web hosting space.</p> 
             <p id="comment-like-43188" data-liked="comment-not-liked" class="comment-likes comment-not-liked"><a href="https://steveblank.com/tools-and-blogs-for-entrepreneurs/?like_comment=43188&amp;_wpnonce=3374b48c58" class="comment-like-link needs-login" rel="nofollow" data-blog="6599589"><span>Like</span></a><span id="comment-like-count-43188" class="comment-like-feedback">Like</span></p>

             <p>I developed a small tool that helps those working with the Business Model Canvas to visualize Customer Archetipes by providing complementary canvas that go from Empathy Maps to Value Proposition Design.</p> 
             <p>I wish I have found your work before I started with it… but here a link to the app just in case you think it could have a place in your list of Customer Development Tools:</p> 
             <p>Personas for iPad:</p> 
             <p><a href="http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/personas/id577884717?mt=8" rel="nofollow">http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/personas/id577884717?mt=8</a></p>
